subject: Ethics
title: Justice in Healthcare
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Justice in Healthcare.

hook.text: In the U.S., the same heart surgery costs $70,000 or $200,000 depending on which hospital you walk into.

buildup.text: Justice in healthcare means distributing medical resources fairly regardless of wealth, race, or status.

discovery.text: The principle demands equal treatment for equal need. A billionaire's broken arm isn't more urgent than yours.

twist.text: But wealthy patients get faster care, better doctors, and experimental treatments the poor never access.

climax.text: Healthcare justice isn't just about fairness in hospitalsâ€”it's about why some people get sick more often.

punchline.text: Same illness, different outcomes. That's the injustice.

quiz.question: What does the principle of justice in healthcare require?
options: Wealthy patients should receive priority because they contribute more to society
Every patient must receive exactly the same treatment regardless of condition
Medical resources should be distributed fairly regardless of wealth, race, or status
